docs.summary: Manage schedules & session

params.name: sessionId
params.doc:
Optional. If this field is given, the participant will be added to this specific session.
Not supported for recurring sessions.

docs.summary:
Adds a participant to a schedule.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Adds a participant to a session.
Adds a participant to a schedule.

docs.summary:
Adds a participant to a session.
> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

params.name: from
params.doc: Time to cancel the sessions from. Optional. If this field is empty, all of this schedule's sessions will be canceled.

params.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
params.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with reservations. Defaults to false.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Cancels a schedule. Equivalent to batch cancel of sessions linked to a single schedule.  
The schedule changes to status = CANCELED -  all sessions up until the time of cancellation are kept, and all future sessions are removed.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Cancel a schedule without notifying participants

examples.title: Cancel Schedule.

extra.description: Cancel a schedule with a custom notification to participants

docs.summary:
Creates a schedule.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Create a schedule with recurring intervals.

examples.title: Create an availability based schedule.

extra.description: Create a schedule for private appointments
Create a schedule with availability

params.name: deleted
params.doc: Session fields to revert to empty, in order to revert to the data inherited from the schedule.

docs.summary:
Creates a session (adds a session to a schedule).
> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Create a session on a a given schedule.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Deletes a session from a schedule.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

examples.title: Delete Session

extra.description: Deletes a session

docs.summary:
Returns a schedule from the calendar.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings permissions scope.  
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the schedule participants are not returned.

extra.description: Requests a schedule by its Id

docs.summary:
Returns a session from the calendar.
> **Permissions**   
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings permission scope.  
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the session participants are not returned.

extra.description: Requests a session by its Id

params.name: dontIncludeScheduleParticipants
params.doc: Whether to return a list of the schedule's participants.

docs.summary:
Lists schedules by schedule IDs or schedule owner IDs.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings  permission scope.  
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the schedule participants are not returned.

extra.description: Returns all the schedules in the site

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to return. Currently only supports the "scheduleOwnerId" field.

docs.summary:
Returns multiple sessions from the calendar.
> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings permission scope
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the sessions return without participants.

extra.description: Returns all the sessions by the requested Ids.
Currently, only the 'scheduleOwnerId' field is supported.

docs.summary:
Returns multiple sessions from the calendar. Only recurring sessions are currently supported.

- **filter**: supports
  - `recurrence`: Filter for the existence of the `session.recurrence`. Currently required and must be `true`.
  - `scheduleId`: Filter by `session.schedule_id`. Supports multiple values. Up to 100 values are allowed. Required.
  - `location`: Filter for the existence of the `session.location`. Can be combined with other `location` filters. Optional.
  - `location.locationType`: Filter by `session.location.location_type`. Supports multiple values. Possible values are `OWNER_BUSINESS`, `OWNER_CUSTOM` and `CUSTOM`. Optional.
  - `location.businessLocation.id`: Filter by `session.location.business_location.id`. Supports multiple values. Optional.

> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings permission scope
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the sessions return without participants.

extra.description: Query all recurring sessions having the provided schedule ids
Query all recurring sessions that have a specific location or no location has been defined for them
Query all recurring sessions that have a location of a certain types

docs.summary:
Removes a participant from a schedule or from a specific session.
Note: Currently, removing *participants that have been inherited from a schedule* from a specific session, is not supported.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Removes a participant

docs.summary:
Create, Update, and Delete multiple sessions in a single request.
All sessions must belong to the same schedule.
Currently only supported for recurring sessions.
> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

params.name: splitTimes
params.doc: A list of times where the interval is to be split. Must not be in the past. Must not contain duplicate times.

docs.summary:
Splits an existing interval into two or more parts.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Split an existing interval into two parts.

params.name: splitTimes
params.doc: A list of times where the session is to be split. Must not be in the past. Must not contain duplicate times.

docs.summary:
Splits a recurring session into two or more parts.
> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Updates an existing recurring interval.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope
Deprecated. Please use UpdateSession instead.

params.name: participant
params.doc: Participant to update, identified by the ID field.

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

docs.summary:
Updates participant details.  
 The field values you specify replace the existing values. Fields that you don’t specify in the request remain unchanged.  
Array fields, if specified, overwrite the existing arrays; this discards any previous array elements.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Updates a participant's phone number.

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

params.name: alignTimeExceptions
params.doc: Optional. Defaults to false. In case of updated intervals' start time, this field indicates whether to align those interval's time exceptions.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Updates a schedule.  
This method supports patch semantics. The field values you specify replace the existing values.  
Fields that you don’t specify in the request remain unchanged.  
 Array fields, if specified, overwrite the existing arrays, and therefore discards any previous array elements.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Patch update the capacity of a schedule.
Updates an interval of a schedule.

params.name: updated
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update. Not supported for recurring sessions.

params.name: deleted
params.doc: Session fields to revert to empty, in order to revert to the data inherited from the schedule. Not supported for recurring sessions.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Updates a session.  
This method supports patch semantics. The field values you specify replace the existing values.
Fields that you don’t specify in the request remain unchanged.
The 'session.id' and 'session.scheduleId' are always required.
 Array fields, if specified, overwrite the existing arrays; and therefore discards any previous array elements.
Updating the Participants field isnt supported.
> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Update the start & end times of a session using the "updated" field mask.
Update a session's rate, result session inherits the rate from the schedule's rate.

members.name: amount
members.doc: The required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: The currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: The amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

messages.name: labeledPriceOptionsMapEntry
messages.displayName: labeled Price Options Map Entry Object

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.

members.name: priceText
members.doc: Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.

members.name: id
members.doc: Participant ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc: Approval status for the participant. Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: repetition
members.doc: The frequency of the recurrence in weeks. i.e. when this value is 4, the interval occurs every 4 weeks. Optional. The default is 1. minimum: 1, maximum: 52.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets a linked schedule's availability between the start and end of the session. Default is `"BUSY"`.
If set to `"BUSY"`, the schedule cannot have any available slots during the session. If set to `"FREE"`, the schedule can have available slots during the session.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

members.name: daysOfWeek
members.doc: The day the interval accrue. Optional. The default is the day of the recurring interval's start time.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: The hour of the day the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval start time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 23.

members.name: minuteOfHour
members.doc: The minutes of hour the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval end time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 59.

members.name: duration
members.doc: The duration of the interval in minutes. Required. Part of the session end time calculation. minimum: 1, maximum: 86400.

members.name: id
members.doc: The recurring interval identifier.

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the recurring interval. Required.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the recurring interval. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: interval
members.doc: The interval rules. The day, hour and minutes the interval is recurring.

members.name: frequency
members.doc: The frequency of the interval. Optional. The default is frequency with the default repetition.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc: Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability. Can be calculated from the schedule or overridden on the recurring interval.

members.name: intervalType
members.doc: The type of recurring interval.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
Unix epoch time.
Required if `local_date_time` is not specified.
If `local_date_time` is specified, `timestamp` is calculated 
as `local_date_time` for the business's timezone in epoch format.

members.name: localDateTime
members.doc: An object containing the local date and time, with no time zone.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The time zone.

members.name: year
members.doc: Year. 4-digit format.

members.name: monthOfYear
members.doc: Month number, from 1-12.

members.name: dayOfMonth
members.doc: Day in the month, from 1-31.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: Hour of the day, in 24-hour format, from 0-23.

members.name: minutesOfHour
members.doc: Minute, from 0-59.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conferencing provider ID

members.name: id
members.doc: Wix Calendar conference ID.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conference provider ID.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: description
members.doc: Conference description.

members.name: conferenceType
members.doc: Conference type.

members.name: accountOwnerId
members.doc: Account owner id in vc service

docs.summary:
Time periods that this location is open for business. Includes a collection of TimePeriod instances.
Aligned with https://developers.google.com/my-business/reference/rest/v4/accounts.locations#businesshours
With a few minor adjustments

members.name: periods
members.doc:
Times that this location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours.

docs.summary:
A span of time that the business is open,
starting on the specified open day/time and closing on the specified close day/time.
Closing time must occur after the opening time, for example later in the same day, or on a subsequent day.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

docs.summary: Set of time periods when a location's operational hours differ from its normal business hours.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: endDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the location

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name of the location

members.name: description
members.doc: Free text to better describe the location

members.name: default
members.doc:
Boolean that states the default location.
There can one default location per site, and changes on it affect on the Site Properties.
The default location can't be deleted and can be only marked through SetDefaultLocation api

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the location. Active by default

members.name: locationType
members.doc: Type of the location

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Time zone

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number

members.name: address
members.doc: Address

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Represents the time periods that this location is open for business. Holds a collection of TimePeriod instances.
TimePeriod indicates when the location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Location revision, represent the number of changes on the location

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Boolean that states if the location is archived.
Archived location can't be updated.

members.name: country
members.doc: country code

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: subdivision (usually state or region) code according to ISO 3166-2

members.name: city
members.doc: city name

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: zip/postal code

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: A break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the human-readable address of this location

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text for human-to-human textual orientation aid purposes

members.name: geocode
members.doc: coordinates of the physical address

docs.summary: A break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: number
members.doc: street number

members.name: name
members.doc: street name

members.name: apt
members.doc: apartment number

docs.summary: Address Geolocation

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude

members.name: country
members.doc: Country code.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Zip/postal code.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text to help find the address.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: countryFullname
members.doc: Country full name.

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: Multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
+ `OWNER_BUSINESS` The business address as set in the site’s general settings.
 + `OWNER_CUSTOM` The address as set when creating the service.
 + `CUSTOM` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: address
members.doc: Free text address used when location_type is `OWNER_CUSTOM`.

members.name: customAddress
members.doc: Custom address, used when location_type is `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`.

members.name: scheduleVersion
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: sessionVersion
members.doc: Session version number, updated each time the session is updated.

members.name: id
members.doc: Session ID.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID that the session belongs to.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID of the schedule that the session belongs to.

members.name: originalStart
members.doc: Original start date and time of the session in Unix epoch time format.

members.name: start
members.doc:
An object specifying the start date and time of the session.
If the session is a recurring session, `start` must contain a local date/time.

members.name: end
members.doc:
An object specifying the end date and time of the session.
The `end` time must be after the `start` time and be same type as `start`.
If the session is a recurring session, `end` must contain a local date/time.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc:
An object specifying a list of linked schedules and the way each schedule's availability is affected. A linked schedule is a schedule that has been associated with another schedule because there is a dependency between the two. This dependency affects the availability of both schedules. For example, the schedule of an instructor is linked to the schedule of the class that they instruct.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule but can still be overridden.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Session title. The default value is the schedule title.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for the session. Optional. Defaults to the schedule's tags.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: location
members.doc:
An object describing the location where the session takes place.
Defaults to the schedule location.
For single sessions, `session.location.businessLocation` can only be provided for locations that are defined in the schedule using `schedule.location` or `schedule.availability.locations`.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the session. Defaults to the schedule capacity.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: rate
members.doc:
The price options offered for the session.  Defaults to the schedule rate.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: timeReservedAfter
members.doc:
Time reserved after the session end time, derived from the schedule availability constraints and the time between slots. Read-only.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: notes
members.doc:
Additional information about the session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc:
The number of participants booked for the session. Read-only.
Calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
List of participants booked for the session.
The list includes participants who have registered for this specific session, and participants who have registered for a schedule that includes this session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc:
A list of properties for which values were inherited from the schedule.
This does not include participants that were inherited from the schedule.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Session status.
 Possible values are:
 `"CONFIRMED"`: Default value.
 `"CANCELLED"`: 
    * The session was generated from a recurring session and then deleted.
    * The session was created as a single session and then deleted.
    * The session is a recurring session and was deleted.

members.name: recurringIntervalId
members.doc:
Recurring interval ID. Defined when a session will be a recurring session. read-only. Optional.
For exmaple, when creating a class service  with recurring sessions, you add a recurrence rule to create recurring sessions.
This field is omitted for single sessions or instances of recurring sessions.
Specified when the session was originally generated from a schedule recurring interval.
Deprecated. Use `recurringSessionId`.

members.name: recurringSessionId
members.doc: Recurring session ID, if the session is a recurring session.

members.name: type
members.doc: Session type.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc:
A conference created for the session according to the details set in the schedule's conference provider information.
If the session is a recurring session, this field is inherited from the schedule.

members.name: recurrence
members.doc:
A string representing a recurrence rule (RRULE) for a recurring session, as defined in [RFC5545](https://icalendar.org/iCalendar-RFC-5545/3-3-10-recurrence-rule.html). 
The RRULE defines a rule for repeating a session.
Supported parameters are:

|Keyword|Description|Supported values|
|--|--|---|
|`FREQ`|The frequency at which the session is recurs. Required.|`WEEKLY`|
|`INTERVAL`|How often, in terms of `FREQ`, the session recurs. Default is 1. Optional.|
|`UNTIL`|The UTC end date and time of the recurrence. Optional.|
|`BYDAY`|Days of the week when the event should recur. Required.|`MO`, `TU`, `WE`, `TH`, `FR`, `SA`, `SU`|


 For example, repeat every second week on a Monday until January 7, 2022 at 8 a.m.:
`FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20220107T080000Z`

 <!--ORIGINAL COMMENTS:
  `FREQ` — The frequency with which the session should be repeated (such as DAILY or WEEKLY).  
 Supported `WEEKLY` value is supported.
  INTERVAL — Works together with FREQ to specify how often the session should be repeated. For example, FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2 means once every two weeks. Optional. Default value is 1.
  COUNT — The number of times this event should be repeated. Not yet supported.
  UNTIL — The UTC date & time until which the session should be repeated. This parameter is optional. When it is not specified, the event repeats forever.
          The format is a short ISO date, followed by 'T' and a short time with seconds and without milliseconds, terminated by the UTC designator 'Z'. For example, until Jan. 19th 2018 at 7:00 AM: 'UNTIL=20180119T070000Z'.
  BYDAY - The days of the week when the event should be repeated. Currently, only a single day is supported. This parameter is mandatory.
       Possible values are: MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA, SU
       Note that DTSTART and DTEND lines are not allowed in this field; session start and end times are specified in the start and end fields.
       **Example**: FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20200427T070000Z
ORIGINAL COMMENTS-->

members.name: version
members.doc: An object containing the session and schedule versions.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change.

members.name: message
members.doc: A custom message to send to the participants.

docs.summary: Availability policy applied to all site schedules.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc: Specify how to split the schedule slots in intervals of minutes.

docs.summary: The time between available slots' start times. For example, For 5 minute slots, 3:00, 3:05, 3:15 etc. For 1 hour slots, 3:00, 4:00, 5:00 etc.

members.name: sameAsDuration
members.doc:
Whether the slot duration is used as the split interval value.
If `same_as_duration` is `true`, the `value_in_minutes` is the sum of the first duration in
`schedule.availabilityConstraints.SlotDurations` field, and `schedule.availabilityConstraints.TimeBetweenSlots` field.

members.name: valueInMinutes
members.doc: Number of minutes between available slots' start times when `same_as_duration` is `false`.

docs.summary:
<!-- Needs updating when recurrence has been tested 
Schedule's availability calculation is executed by the schedule's available intervals and this additional information.
Schedule's available intervals are recurring intervals (defined in the schedule) minus sessions that has no more spots for bookings (including time between_slots), or schedule's sessions with open spots for bookings.-->

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the schedule starts to be available for booking. For example, a schedule can become available at a future date.

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the schedule stops being available for booking. No value indicates no end time.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc: Other schedules that impact the availability calculation. Relevant only when there are availability constraints.

members.name: constraints
members.doc: Constraints for calculating the schedule's availability.

docs.summary: Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

members.name: slotDurations
members.doc:
A list of duration options for slots, in minutes. Minimum value for a duration is 1.
The availability calculation generates slots with these durations, where there is no conflict with existing sessions or other availability constraints.

members.name: timeBetweenSlots
members.doc:
The number of minutes between the `end` of one slot, and the `start` of the next. 
Minimum value is 0, maximum value is 120.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).
Optional. The default is the first duration in slot_durations field.
Deprecated. Use the `split_slots_interval.value_in_minutes`.

members.name: slotsSplitInterval
members.doc: An object defining the time between available slots' start times.  For example, a slot with slots_split_interval=5 can start every 5 minutes. The default is the slot duration.

members.name: id
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the schedule's owner entity. This may be a resource ID, a session ID, or a service ID.

members.name: intervals
members.doc:
Specifies the intervals for the sessions calculation. Optional. e.g. when creating class service you can add
pattern for recurring intervals, these intervals can be returned as schedule's sessions or available slots if
there are no other availability calculation constraints and the capacity is bigger then the current total number of sessions' participants.

members.name: title
members.doc: Default title for the schedule's sessions. Maximum length: 6000 characters.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for grouping schedules. These tags are the default tags for the schedule's sessions.
The Wix Bookings app uses the following predefined tags: `INDIVIDUAL`, `GROUP`, and `COURSE`. However, you can use your own tags if you're not using the app.

members.name: location
members.doc: Default location for the schedule's sessions.

members.name: capacity
members.doc: Maximum number of participants that can be added to the schedule's sessions. Default is 1.

members.name: rate
members.doc: Price options offered when booking this schedule's slots. Default is no rate.

members.name: availability
members.doc:
An object describing how to calculate the schedule's availability.
An empty object indicates that the schedule is not available for booking.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants registered to sessions in this schedule, calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
Participants currently registered to sessions in this schedule.
Participants who are registered in the schedule are automatically registered to any session that is created for the schedule.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).

members.name: status
members.doc: Schedule status.

members.name: created
members.doc: Schedule creation date.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Schedule last update date.

members.name: version
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: Fields which were inherited from the Business Info page under Settings in the Dashboard.

members.name: conferenceProvider
members.doc: Conferencing Provider. A schedule with a conferencing provider will use to provider information to create a conference on the provider's system when a session is created on the schedule or on one of its linked schedule's.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc: A conference created for the schedule. This is used when a participant is added to a schedule.

extra.description: Schedule canceled.

examples.title: Schedule updated notification

extra.description: Schedule updated.
Schedule created.

examples.title: Session created notification

extra.description: Session created.

examples.title: Session updaed notification

extra.description: Session updaed.

examples.title: Session canceled notification

extra.description: Session canceled.
Availability policy updated.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about changed sessions. deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: siteProperties
members.doc: site properties. Optional. Given in create schedule notification.

members.name: multipleSessionsCreated
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: migrationEvent
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: oldSchedule
members.doc: The old schedule before the update.

members.name: newSchedule
members.doc: The new schedule after the update.

members.name: recurringSessions
members.doc:
Recurring sessions updated event. If this field is given, the reason for the schedule updated event was
updating at least one of the given schedule's recurring sessions.
This event is triggered by create/update/delete recurring session apis.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether this notification was created as a result of an anonymization request, such as GDPR.
 An anonymized participant will have the following details:
 name = "deleted"
 phone = "deleted"
 email = "deleted@deleted.com"

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest

Whether this notification was created as a result of an anonymization request, such as GDPR.
 An anonymized participant will have the following details:

 phone = "deleted"
 email = "deleted@deleted.com"

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The global time zone value.

members.name: oldRecurringSessions
members.doc: Old schedule's recurring session list.

members.name: newRecurringSessions
members.doc: New schedule's recurring session list.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: offset
members.doc: number of items to skip in the current sort order

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used and 'too_many_to_count' flag is not set

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: A flag that indicates the server failed to calculate 'total' field

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next result page

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous result page

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order (ASC/DESC). Defaults to ASC

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: paging
members.doc: Limit number of results

members.name: fields
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of specific field names to return. If fieldsets are also specified, return the union of fieldsets and fields

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of named projections. E.g. "basic" will return id and name fields. Specifying multiple fieldsets will return the union of fields from all. Specifying fieldsets and fields will also return the union of fields.

members.name: cancelRequests
members.doc:
Cancel multiple schedules.
The given schedules move to a CANCELLED status which means that all sessions up until
the cancellation point in time are kept, while removing all following sessions.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Default.
  • PENDING - Pending business approval.
  • APPROVED - Approved by the business.
  • DECLINED - Declined by the business.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • FREE - The schedule can have available slots during the session.
  • BUSY - The schedule cannot have available slots during the session. Default value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Undefined.
  • MON - Monday.
  • TUE - Tuesday.
  • WED - Wednesday.
  • THU - Thursday.
  • FRI - Friday.
  • SAT - Saturday.
  • SUN - Sunday.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
  • EVENT - A recurring interval of events
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - A recurring interval for availability

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • EVENT - The session creates an event on the calendar for the owner of the schedule that the session belongs to. Default type.
  • WORKING_HOURS - Deprecated. The session type is working hours. Represents intervals masked as working hours in the schedule owner's schedule.
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - The session represents a resource's available hours.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER - API-generated online meeting.
  • CUSTOM - User-defined meeting.

Enumerates the days of the week. Possible values are:
  • MONDAY
  • TUESDAY
  • WEDNESDAY
  • THURSDAY
  • FRIDAY
  • SATURDAY
  • SUNDAY

For future use Possible values are:
  • ACTIVE
  • IN_ACTIVE

For future use Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • BRANCH
  • OFFICES
  • RECEPTION
  • HEADQUARTERS

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BUSINESS
  • OWNER_CUSTOM
  • CUSTOM

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CONFIRMED - The session is confirmed. Default status.
  • CANCELLED - The session is cancelled. A cancelled session can be the cancellation of a recurring session that should no longer be displayed or a deleted single session. The ListSessions returns cancelled sessions only if 'includeDelete' flag is set to true.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CREATED - The default value when the schedule is created.
  • CANCELLED - The schedule has been cancelled.

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC
